subject: Re: [junit] Invoking junit.textui.TestRunner from javacode
msgSnippet: ... Not sure I understand what you re trying to do, but hopefully this will help. To invoke junit from java code, create a TestResult and call the run method
messageBody:
On Tue, 22 Mar 2005 08:55:45 -0000, b_sommerbakk <bjornos@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi all
>
> I am having some truble invoking junit from javacode. My testcode
> test code in a package located on my computer but it sems like it
> doesent find it. I collect all test in a testsuite and run them with
> junit.textui.TestRunner. As long as the testcode are not dependent
> on the code in the jar it runs ok.
> I have tried setting the path to the jar-file with System.setProperty
> ("java.class.path",newClasspath) in the code but it doesent help at
> all.
>
> I hope someone would give me som help here! :o)
>
>
Not sure I understand what you're trying to do, but hopefully this will help.

To invoke junit from java code, create a TestResult and call the run
method of your suite, passing in the TestResult object. You might
want to add listeners to the TestResult, or just inspect it after the
tests have run.

James
